name: 蔡銘修
objective: This course helps the learners recognize the syntax, style, and organization as far as the papers on English writings are concerned.
schedule:
01 02/23 Intro(research topic)
02 03/02 Endnote and Turnitin (bring your own laptop)
03 03/09 Research- Abstract
04 03/16 Research Method 1(online course)
05 03/23 Research- Introduction 1
06 03/30 Research- Introduction 2
07 04/06 No Class
08 04/13 Research- Literature Review & Introduction Practice
09 04/20 Midterm Week
10 04/27 Definition of terms
11 05/04 Research- Method 2
12 05/11 Research Result 
13 05/18 Research Discussion, Conclusion and Suggest
14 05/25 Final Presentation Preparation
15 06/01 Conference(No Class)
16 06/08 Final Presentation(12 mins per student)
17 06/15 Writing for Final Paper
18 06/22 Final Exam Week (final paper due)
scorePolicy:
Grading:
1. Attendance 15%
2. Abstract 20%  
3. Final Presentation 25%
4. Final Research Paper 40% 
    - 12 font, 1.5 spaces
    - suggest full paper (7 pages)
5. Additional grade 5% (papers are accepted in International journal or conference)
materials:
Academic Writing for Graduate Students 3/e
Author: John M. Swales, & Christine B. Feak
Publisher: Michigan Press
Publication date: 2013/3
ISBN: 9780472034758
